item.title: Extract information with encoding in R
item.description: Are you a non English R user? In my case, Spanish language has the following letters: √°, √©, √≠, √≥, √∫, √º and √±. This letters are saved different depending on the encoding (computation language) of the table you are extracting the data. And reading them might cause some headaches. Tips To avoid having strange characters when reading the previews letters, make sure you are extracting the data with the same encoding of the table from your database (check properties of the table) or excel file.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.
